Follow me on Twitch If you want to catch some classic Skyblock Modpack streams!
https://www.twitch.tv/xisuma

You can use waterlocked trapdoors instead of pistons. That allows the water to flow one block further, making the spawning platforms bigger. This is a simpler and cheaper solution for all kinds of flushing farms.

0:18
The Hermits are responsible for climate change

comments_since_last_sample.body: Moving a waterlogged stair removes the water?! How the heck does Doc's tunnel bore work, then?!

0:18
The Hermits are responsible for climate change

I would have said you could use waterlogged trapdoors.
That gives you one more block range compared to the piston trick, and just needs wood (or iron if you want to be fancy).
You could say that you are getting ready for Christmas with the snow
The Kingdom of Red Sand has been founded.

On the contrary, "Founded" IS a proper word, as the past tense of the verb "found," whose definitions are:
1. to set up or establish on a firm basis or for enduring existence
2. to lay the lowest part of (a structure) on a firm based or ground
3. to base or ground (usually followed by "on" or "upon")
4. to provide a basis or ground for

...Why, no, I don't have a life, why do you ask?
foundend means to make a country: I founded Romania.
If red sand has been taken, it's most likely cubfan135
Cool putting the new Minecraft 1.18 music in the background!
Great to see another use for target blocks
I think it's tragic that you can't craft red sand with normal sand and red dye 😩 just one more little thing Mojang needs to add 🤷‍♂️

Mojang: Yeah we’re taking away bundles
Doc: Fine, I’ll fix that problem myself
😂
14:57 the laugh of your average gamer who plays several hours a day
if only vanilla tweaks had a red sand recipe like it does for red sandstone!

Season 8 reminds me of season 4 with all the terraforming projects
Boatem mountains,cubfan’s canyon,welsknight floating island,big eye mountain,the northern swamp, etc.

You can use waterlocked trapdoors instead of pistons. That allows the water to flow one block further, making the spawning platforms bigger. This is a simpler and cheaper solution for all kinds of flushing farms.
